workflow.name: Automated dynamic pricing with AI competitor monitoring & revenue optimization
workflow.description:
*This workflow contains community nodes that are only compatible with the self-hosted version of n8n.*

# How it works

This workflow automatically monitors competitor prices, analyzes market demand, and optimizes product pricing in real-time for maximum profitability using advanced AI algorithms.

## Key Steps

1. **Hourly Trigger** - Runs automatically every hour for real-time price optimization and competitive response.
2. **Multi-Platform Competitor Monitoring** - Uses AI-powered scrapers to track prices from Amazon, Best Buy, Walmart, and Target.
3. **Market Demand Analysis** - Analyzes Google Trends data to understand search volume trends and seasonal patterns.
4. **Customer Sentiment Analysis** - Reviews customer feedback to assess price sensitivity and value perception.
5. **AI Pricing Optimization** - Calculates optimal prices using weighted factors including competitor positioning, demand indicators, and inventory levels.
6. **Automated Price Updates** - Directly updates e-commerce platform prices when significant opportunities are identified.
7. **Comprehensive Analytics** - Logs all pricing decisions and revenue projections to Google Sheets for performance tracking.

## Set up steps

**Setup time: 15-20 minutes**

1. **Configure ScrapeGraphAI credentials** - Add your ScrapeGraphAI API key for AI-powered competitor and market analysis.
2. **Set up e-commerce API connection** - Connect your e-commerce platform API for automated price updates.
3. **Configure Google Sheets** - Set up Google Sheets connections for pricing history and revenue analytics logging.
4. **Set up Slack notifications** - Connect your Slack workspace for real-time pricing alerts and team updates.
5. **Customize product catalog** - Modify the product configuration with your actual products, costs, and pricing constraints.
6. **Adjust monitoring frequency** - Change the trigger timing based on your business needs (hourly, daily, etc.).
7. **Configure competitor platforms** - Update competitor URLs and selectors for your target market.

## What you get

- **Real-time price optimization** with 15-25% potential revenue increase through intelligent pricing
- **Competitive intelligence** with automated monitoring of major e-commerce platforms
- **Market demand insights** with seasonal and trend-based pricing adjustments
- **Customer sentiment analysis** to understand price sensitivity and value perception
- **Automated price updates** when significant opportunities are identified (>2% change, >70% confidence)
- **Comprehensive analytics** with pricing history, revenue projections, and performance tracking
- **Team notifications** with detailed market analysis and pricing recommendations
- **Margin protection** with intelligent constraints to maintain profitability

nodes.name: Hourly Pricing Monitor Trigger
nodes.notes: Triggers every hour for real-time price optimization

parameters.userPrompt: Extract competitor pricing data from this e-commerce search results page. Focus on products similar to our target product and their pricing information. Use this schema: { "competitor": "Amazon", "search_keyword": "wireless headphones", "products_found": [{ "product_name": "Sony WH-CH720N Wireless Headphones", "brand": "Sony", "price": 89.99, "original_price": 129.99, "discount_percentage": 31, "rating": 4.5, "review_count": 1247, "availability": "In Stock", "shipping_info": "Free shipping", "seller": "Amazon", "product_url": "https://amazon.com/dp/B09XXXX", "features": ["Noise Canceling", "30hr Battery"], "similar_to_target": true, "relevance_score": 0.85 }], "price_statistics": { "min_price": 45.99, "max_price": 199.99, "avg_price": 92.45, "median_price": 89.99, "price_range": 154.00 }, "market_insights": { "total_products": 12, "brands_found": ["Sony", "JBL", "Bose"], "avg_rating": 4.3, "price_trend": "stable", "promotion_frequency": "high" } }

Analyze search demand trends for this product keyword to assess market demand and pricing opportunities. Extract trend data and demand indicators. Schema: { "keyword": "wireless headphones", "search_volume_trend": "rising", "interest_score": 78, "related_queries": [{ "query": "best wireless headphones", "growth": "+25%" }, { "query": "cheap bluetooth headphones", "growth": "+15%" }], "geographic_interest": [{ "region": "United States", "interest": 100 }, { "region": "Canada", "interest": 67 }], "seasonal_patterns": { "current_vs_avg": 1.15, "peak_months": ["November", "December"], "low_months": ["January", "February"] }, "demand_indicators": { "price_sensitivity": "medium", "brand_loyalty": "low", "purchase_urgency": "medium", "comparison_shopping": "high" }, "market_saturation": "medium", "growth_opportunity": "high" }

Analyze customer reviews and sentiment for products in this category to understand price sensitivity and value perception. Extract customer insights that inform pricing decisions. Schema: { "category": "wireless headphones", "total_reviews_analyzed": 156, "sentiment_analysis": { "positive": 0.68, "neutral": 0.22, "negative": 0.10 }, "price_mentions": [{ "price_point": "$50-80", "sentiment": "positive", "frequency": 45, "context": "good value for money" }, { "price_point": "$80-120", "sentiment": "mixed", "frequency": 32, "context": "expensive but worth it" }], "value_drivers": [{ "feature": "battery life", "importance": 0.85, "satisfaction": 0.78 }, { "feature": "sound quality", "importance": 0.92, "satisfaction": 0.81 }], "price_complaints": [{ "issue": "overpriced for features", "frequency": 23 }, { "issue": "better alternatives available", "frequency": 18 }], "purchase_drivers": ["sound quality", "brand reputation", "battery life", "comfort"], "price_elasticity_indicators": { "willingness_to_pay_premium": 0.34, "price_sensitivity_score": 0.67, "brand_premium_acceptance": 0.45 } }

parameters.content:
# ðŸ’° AI-Powered Dynamic Pricing Optimizer

**Created: July 25, 2025**

This comprehensive workflow automatically monitors competitor prices, analyzes market demand, and optimizes product pricing in real-time for maximum profitability.

## ðŸš€ Key Features
- **Hourly Price Monitoring**: Real-time competitor price tracking
- **Multi-Platform Analysis**: Amazon, Best Buy, Walmart, Target
- **AI-Powered Optimization**: Advanced pricing algorithms
- **Demand Analysis**: Google Trends and search volume insights
- **Customer Sentiment**: Review analysis for price sensitivity
- **Revenue Projections**: Profit impact calculations
- **Automated Updates**: Direct e-commerce platform integration

## ðŸ“Š Benefits
- **15-25% Revenue Increase** through optimal pricing
- **Real-Time Market Response** to competitor changes
- **Margin Protection** with intelligent constraints
- **24/7 Automation** without manual intervention
- **Data-Driven Decisions** with comprehensive analytics

# â±ï¸ Step 1: Hourly Pricing Monitor Trigger

**This Node**: Automatically triggers every hour for real-time pricing optimization

## Why Hourly Monitoring?
- **Competitive Advantage**: Respond to competitor price changes immediately
- **Market Dynamics**: Capture demand fluctuations throughout the day
- **Revenue Optimization**: Maximize profits during peak demand periods
- **Inventory Management**: Adjust prices based on stock levels

## Configuration Options
- **Frequency**: Adjustable from every 15 minutes to daily
- **Business Hours Only**: Optional limitation to business hours
- **Weekend Scheduling**: Configure weekend vs. weekday strategies
- **Holiday Handling**: Special pricing during sales events

## Performance Considerations
- **API Rate Limits**: Manages scraping frequency to avoid blocks
- **Cost Optimization**: Balances monitoring frequency with API costs
- **Error Handling**: Continues operation despite individual failures
- **Scalability**: Supports hundreds of products simultaneously

# ðŸ”§ Step 2: Pricing Configuration Processor

**This Node**: Processes product catalog, competitor settings, and market context for pricing optimization

## Product Catalog Management
- **Product Profiles**: Complete pricing parameters per product
- **Cost Integration**: Real-time cost price updates
- **Margin Controls**: Min/max margin protection
- **Inventory Sync**: Stock level-based pricing strategies

## Competitor Monitoring Setup
- **Multi-Platform**: Amazon, Best Buy, Walmart, Target
- **Weighted Influence**: Different competitor impact levels
- **Product Matching**: AI-powered similar product identification
- **Price Point Tracking**: Multiple price variants per product

## Market Context Analysis
- **Seasonality Factors**: Q1-Q4 demand multipliers
- **Day-of-Week Patterns**: Weekend vs. weekday pricing
- **Time-of-Day Optimization**: Peak shopping hour adjustments
- **Demand Correlation**: Multiple factor impact modeling

## Strategy Configuration
- **Aggressive**: Beat competitors by 5-10% (high inventory)
- **Competitive**: Match market average (normal inventory)
- **Premium**: 10-20% above market (low inventory)
- **Dynamic Switching**: Auto-strategy selection based on conditions

# ðŸ”„ Step 3: Split Monitoring Tasks

**This Node**: Breaks down the monitoring process into individual product-competitor combinations for parallel processing

## Task Distribution
- **Batch Processing**: Handles multiple products simultaneously
- **Load Balancing**: Distributes scraping tasks evenly
- **Parallel Execution**: Enables concurrent data collection
- **Error Isolation**: Prevents single failures from stopping entire process

## Efficiency Benefits
- **Faster Processing**: Multiple scrapers run simultaneously
- **Resource Optimization**: Better utilization of API limits
- **Scalability**: Easy to add more products or competitors
- **Reliability**: Independent processing reduces failure points

## Task Structure
- **Product Information**: ID, name, current price, costs
- **Competitor Mapping**: Platform URLs and search terms
- **Market Context**: Time-based demand factors
- **Batch Tracking**: Progress monitoring and session management

# ðŸŽ›ï¸ Step 4: Task Processor

**This Node**: Prepares individual monitoring tasks with enhanced context data for the AI scrapers

## Task Enhancement
- **URL Generation**: Creates specific search URLs for each competitor platform
- **Context Addition**: Adds market timing and demand factors
- **Data Structuring**: Formats data for optimal AI scraper performance
- **Session Tracking**: Maintains batch progress and correlation

## Data Preparation
- **Product Context**: Current pricing and inventory data
- **Market Timing**: Hour, day, season, and demand multipliers
- **Competitor Focus**: Platform-specific search parameters
- **Quality Controls**: Data validation and error handling

## Output Optimization
- **Structured Queries**: Consistent format for AI scrapers
- **Batch Correlation**: Links tasks to overall session
- **Performance Tracking**: Monitors processing efficiency
- **Error Handling**: Graceful failure management

# ðŸ¤– Steps 5-7: Multi-Source AI Scraping Network

**These Nodes**: Three specialized AI scrapers running in parallel for comprehensive market analysis

## ðŸ’µ Competitor Price Scraper (Step 5)
- **Platforms**: Amazon, Best Buy, Walmart, Target
- **Data Points**: Prices, discounts, ratings, availability
- **Intelligence**: Product matching, price statistics, market trends
- **Output**: Min/max/avg prices, promotion frequency, brand analysis

## ðŸ“ˆ Demand Analysis Scraper (Step 6)
- **Source**: Google Trends and search volume data
- **Metrics**: Search trends, related queries, geographic interest
- **Intelligence**: Seasonal patterns, demand indicators, growth opportunities
- **Output**: Interest scores, trend velocity, market saturation analysis

## ðŸ’­ Customer Sentiment Scraper (Step 7)
- **Source**: Product reviews and customer feedback
- **Analysis**: Price sensitivity, value perception, satisfaction
- **Intelligence**: Purchase drivers, price complaints, elasticity indicators
- **Output**: Sentiment scores, willingness to pay premium, brand loyalty

## ðŸ§  AI Processing Benefits
- **Real-Time Analysis**: Fresh market data every hour
- **Structured Output**: Consistent JSON schemas for analysis
- **Quality Filtering**: Relevance scoring and data validation
- **Market Intelligence**: Context-aware pricing insights

# ðŸ”— Step 8: Merge Pricing Data

**This Node**: Combines data from all three AI scrapers into a unified dataset for analysis

## Data Integration
- **Multi-Source Combination**: Merges competitor, demand, and sentiment data
- **Data Correlation**: Links related information across different sources
- **Quality Validation**: Ensures data consistency and completeness
- **Structure Standardization**: Creates uniform data format for analysis

## Merge Strategy
- **Position-Based Combination**: Aligns data from parallel scraper executions
- **Error Handling**: Manages missing or incomplete data gracefully
- **Data Enrichment**: Adds metadata and processing timestamps
- **Performance Optimization**: Efficient data structure for analysis engine

## Output Preparation
- **Unified Dataset**: Single comprehensive data object
- **Analysis Ready**: Structured for optimization algorithm
- **Context Preservation**: Maintains market timing and product information
- **Quality Metrics**: Includes data confidence and completeness scores

# ðŸ§  Step 9: Pricing Optimization Engine

**This Node**: Advanced AI algorithm that calculates optimal pricing based on all market factors

## Optimization Factors (Weighted)
- **Competitor Analysis (35%)**: Position relative to market average
- **Demand Indicators (25%)**: Search trends and seasonal patterns
- **Customer Sentiment (20%)**: Price sensitivity and satisfaction
- **Inventory Levels (10%)**: Stock-based pricing adjustments
- **Margin Protection (10%)**: Profitability safeguards

## Advanced Algorithms
- **Competitive Positioning**: Smart pricing relative to market leaders
- **Demand Elasticity**: Price sensitivity impact modeling
- **Inventory Optimization**: Stock velocity pricing adjustments
- **Revenue Maximization**: Profit vs. volume optimization
- **Risk Assessment**: Confidence scoring for price changes

## Price Change Controls
- **Maximum Change**: 15% per hour to prevent market shock
- **Minimum Threshold**: Only change prices >2% difference
- **Margin Protection**: Never go below minimum margin requirements
- **Price Constraints**: Respect min/max price boundaries

## Strategy Selection Logic
- **Aggressive**: High inventory + competitive pressure
- **Premium**: Low inventory + strong demand
- **Competitive**: Normal conditions + market alignment

# ðŸŽ¯ Step 10: Price Change Filter

**This Node**: Intelligent filtering system that determines which price changes should be implemented

## Filtering Criteria
- **Significance Threshold**: Only process changes >2% to avoid noise
- **Confidence Gating**: Require >70% confidence for implementation
- **Market Validation**: Cross-reference multiple data sources
- **Risk Assessment**: Evaluate potential negative impacts

## Quality Gates
- **Data Quality Check**: Ensure all required data is present
- **Margin Verification**: Confirm profitability is maintained
- **Competitive Position**: Validate market positioning makes sense
- **Revenue Impact**: Estimate financial consequences

## Decision Logic
- **AND Condition**: Both significance AND confidence must be met
- **Safety Override**: Manual controls can bypass filters
- **Test Mode**: Option to simulate without actual changes
- **Approval Workflow**: Optional human review for large changes

## Output Routing
- **Approved Changes**: Route to price update API and notifications
- **Rejected Changes**: Log for analysis but don't implement
- **All Changes**: Log to analytics regardless of approval status

# ðŸ“Š Steps 11-15: Analytics & Communication

**These Nodes**: Comprehensive tracking, reporting, and team communication system

## Step 11: Price Update API Call
- **E-commerce Integration**: Direct price updates to your platform
- **API Authentication**: Secure connection to pricing system
- **Batch Processing**: Efficient bulk price updates
- **Error Handling**: Retry logic and failure management

## Steps 12-13: Google Sheets Logging
- **Pricing History**: Every change logged with full context
- **Revenue Analytics**: Performance tracking and projections
- **Trend Analysis**: Historical patterns and insights
- **Dashboard Integration**: Real-time reporting capabilities

## Step 14: Slack Notifications
- **Instant Alerts**: Immediate notifications for price changes
- **Smart Formatting**: Rich context with market analysis
- **Team Coordination**: Channel-based communication
- **Performance Metrics**: Summary statistics and trends

## Step 15: Email Reports
- **Executive Summaries**: HTML-formatted comprehensive reports
- **Market Intelligence**: Competitor analysis and insights
- **Revenue Impact**: Financial performance and projections
- **Strategic Recommendations**: Next steps and opportunities

## Success Tracking
- **Real-Time Monitoring**: Continuous performance measurement
- **ROI Analysis**: Revenue impact and optimization effectiveness
- **Market Position**: Competitive advantage tracking

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
